definitions.definition: the movement of people or goods from one place to another:
a system of vehicles, such as buses, trains, aircraft, etc. for getting from one place to another:
to take goods or people from one place to another:
examples: The pipeline was constructed to transport oil across Alaska to ports on the coast.

definitions.definition: (in the past) to send a criminal to live in a country far away as a punishment:
examples: 162,000 convicts were transported to Australia from 1788 to 1868.
